Intake and Admissions Manager

Company Name mecwacare Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are looking for an experienced Intake and Admissions Manager
Intake and Admissions Manager
  • Full Time Position- 3 Year Contract
  • Malvern Location
  • Generous Salary Packaging Options

We are looking for an experienced Intake and Admissions Manager who, as the face of mecwacare, will be responsible for providing a first and long-lasting impression for enquiries and admissions into mecwacare services. This role will provide advice and support to prospective clients and their family in addition to ensuring timely and appropriate placement into mecwacare services where the new client’s care and service needs can be most effectively met.

To Be Successful, Applicants Must Have
  • Customer service ethos, skills and practices, as demonstrated by experience and/or qualifications
  • Proven ability in lead generation, closing deals and achieving targets in a sales / property role
  • Advances skills in myagedcare, and relevant experience in homecare admissions, packages and CHSP
  • Excellent time management and multi-tasking skills
  • Initiative and high level of motivation
  • Strong financial acumen
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Demonstrated attention to detail in administrative tasks
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong relationship building capabilities
  • Commitment to maintaining confidentiality in all matters
  • Successfully complete online course on ‘Maximising Income’ prior to commencement
  • Knowledge of Windows computer applications, including word processing, spreadsheets and data base programs as well as fast and accurate typing
  • Current Victorian Driver’s Licence and Working with Children Card


Desirable
  • Knowledge of the Aged Care Act and Principles 1997 and other regulatory requirements relevant to residential aged care
  • Knowledge of and experience in a range of funded programs e.g. Home and Community Care (HACC), Department of Veterans Affairs (DVA) etc
  • Relevant qualifications in a health-related discipline, or other qualification with relevant experience in community or aged care service provision
  • Sound knowledge of community service principles and processes
  • Previous experience in the aged care, community service or health sector

mecwacare is a leading not-for-profit organisation with a reputation for excellence. mecwacare has provided care to the Victorian community for over 58 years, offering residential aged care, home care packages, respite care, in-home support, community housing, community programs, disability and nursing services. We provide optimal choice for people of all ages, irrespective of financial, religious, cultural or lifestyle background. We care for more than 12,000 people each week across greater Melbourne and regional Victoria through a highly-integrated service network operated by more than 1,600 employees and 350 volunteers.

mecwacare offers opportunities for professional development, with an ongoing learning culture and supportive team environment. If you are passionate about supporting best practice and consumer focused outcomes through staff engagement and skills development and wish to benefit from our generous salary packaging options, please contact us. All successful applicants will need to undergo a Police Check.

Enquires to Susan Camilleri on 03 8573 4814.

  • Nonprofit Organization Management
  • Government Administration
  • Hospital & Health Care

[

Full Stack Java Developer

Company Name IRESS Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Full Stack Java Developer
Be part of something amazing

We’re the technology partner to some of the world’s most iconic financial services brands. Our software solutions help with life’s big decisions and enable our clients to help people all over the world build their wealth, protect their family, buy their home, invest in the stock market, and improve their financial wellbeing. We call that real career satisfaction.

Job title: Java Full Stack Web Developer

Operational area: Development Superannuation

Reports to: Integration Development Manager

Location: Melbourne

Role Purpose

Position will focus on the development of a product that is a critical messaging platform, encompassing a java based server side that deals with authentication and secure storage, transformation and transmission of messages via REST and SOAP services, and an administration web portal for administering the platform and providing user self-service where appropriate.

The candidate will have good knowledge of Java and web technologies such as HTML, CSS and JavaScript. A development focused degree or significant previous experience with development methodologies and best practices is mandatory. Knowledge of the Australian Superannuation domain and/or exposure to secure messaging services is desirable but not mandatory.

Accountabilities & Deliverables

  • Develop and maintain software programs in accordance with programming specifications. This includes (but is not limited to):
    • Java development
    • HTML, CSS and JavaScript development
  • Liaise with Business Analysts, Development and Quality Assurance team members to clarify technical requirements and implement the required functionality.
  • Assist with troubleshooting and diagnosis of issues and defects within the scope of Acurity functionality.
  • Provide client support to address specific client needs
  • Work independently and be self-sufficient, whilst having the skills to work collaboratively with business representatives, development and quality assurance team members.
  • Be flexible and responsive to fulfilling other duties as required.
  • Contribute to IRESS’s continual drive for Process Improvement
  • Participate in reviews of functionality from a technical and security perspective.

Key Relationships

  • Client representatives
  • IRESS team members

Core Skills, Knowledge and Attributes

  • Successful completion of VCE/Higher School Certificate
  • IT / Computer Science degree or other tertiary qualification related to development and / or development best practices.
  • 2 years minimum working experience as a developer using Java and web related technologies
  • Desirable - Practical experience with superannuation technology systems
  • Desirable - Knowledge of the Australian Superannuation domain
  • Desirable - Knowledge and development experience using the IRESS product set

Key Competencies

  • Working experience of
    • HTML
    • Java
    • CSS
    • JavaScript (TypeScript experience highly preferable).
    • CSS libraries (Like Bootstrap)
    • Javascript libraries (Like JQuery)
  • Experience with Source control systems (e.g. GIT/Mecurial)
  • Experience with unit testing and unit testing frameworks
  • Practical knowledge of Java based web server technology
  • Strong analytical, problem solving skill and high attention to detail
  • Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new technologies as required
  • Ability to build solid working relationships with internal staff and clients
  • Demonstrate initiative and be proactive
  • The ability to work autonomously and be self-motivated to meet deadlines.
  • Good time management, organisational and prioritisation skills
  • A ‘can do’ attitude and be able to apply a methodical approach to problem solving
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work within both Agile and waterfall based methodologies

What we offer you in return

It’s a clich\xe9, but we work hard and we play hard. We recognise and reward hard work with a great benefits package. On top of a good remuneration package we’ll give you a generous holiday allowance, retirement fund and insurances. We provide a flexible work environment and like to get our people together to have fun whether it's over a drink on a Friday afternoon, having a friendly kick about on the footy field or doing some team bonding for a charity event. We don’t sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are.

With offices worldwide, we offer exciting opportunities for you to learn, grow and progress. A career at IRESS really can take you anywhere.

Employee

Time Type
Full time

Associate

  • Computer Software
  • Financial Services

Kinexus is the leading supplier of recruitment solutions to the Defence and Aerospace industries. We have an upcoming opportunities for two Mechanical Engineers to join one of our Defence clients on a contract basis located in Melbourne's inner suburbs.

The role involves maintenance and upgrade work on naval equipment. Maritime/Naval experience is a strong preference, although commercial shipbuilding experience will also be considered. Applicants must be Australian citizens and ITAR compliant.

Security clearances - Baseline or NV1 - strong preference.

Key Attributes Include
  • Tertiary qualifications in Mechanical Engineering or similar
  • Proven experience working within a Marine environment
  • Proven experience in Mechanical maintenance and upgrade projects
  • Australian Citizen prepared to undergo a security clearance

This is a great opportunity to gain experience working for a major Defence prime at an exciting time to be in the Defence industry.

Community Connections Coordinator

Company Name Yooralla Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Opportunity to work alongside and empower people with disability to reach their maximum potential
  • Great team environment
  • Salary packaging benefits
Division: Community Services
Location: Melbourne CBD
Type: Permanent Part Time (19 hours per week)
Job reference: 1515
Applications close: 17 July 2018

About Us

At Yooralla, we believe that exceptional customer service starts with employees who love what they do. Our people are committed to supporting people with disabilities to live the life they choose and obtaining the best possible outcomes for our customers. We have played an active role in improving public awareness and progressing the nature of disability support in Australia for 100 years.

About The Role

Yooralla's Personalised Services is seeking a passionate, experienced and dedicated individual to join their friendly and supportive team of Disability Specialists. Reporting to the Group Manager - Community Access, you will assist the Personalised Services team with program coordination, service delivery, planning and staff rostering, supervision and support.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will need:
  • Relevant tertiary qualifications
  • Demonstrated experience in co-ordinating supports for people with disability.
  • Demonstrated experience in working with people with disability and in all aspects of direct service delivery and attendant care support.
  • Demonstrated experience in working with complex participants and complex family structures.
  • Understanding of disability sector changes and dynamics, particularly in relation to the National Disability Insurance Scheme.
  • Demonstrated experience in the leadership, recruitment, training and support of staff.
  • Demonstrated ability to work autonomously whilst working collaboratively within a multidisciplinary team.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to debate difficult issues within a decision making process.
  • Experience in the administration of submissions, reports, maintaining statistical data and client files.
  • A current National Police Records Check and international police check (if required)
  • A current First Aid and CPR certificate
  • A current working with children check
  • A full Australian driver's licence
  • Not listed on the Disability Worker Exclusion Scheme (DWES)
Working with Yooralla

We employ individuals dedicated to providing quality, sustainable and flexible services, that uphold human rights and create opportunities, empowering individuals to live the life they choose. Yooralla has a long history of working to build a world where people with disability are equal citizens.

We offer
  • Supportive team environment
  • Salary packaging benefits
  • The opportunity to work alongside and empower people with disability to reach their maximum potential
  • Ongoing training, team support and professional development

For further information please contact Melissa Pool on 0416 035 687.

Please visit our website company website to access a copy of the position description and to apply for this vacancy.

We believe in diversity, inclusion and equality and are committed to ensuring that our workplaces are a reflection of the Victorian community. We recognise the benefits that diversity and inclusion brings, and in turn encourage talented people from all backgrounds, abilities and identities to apply to our vacancies. We strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with a disability to apply.

Appointments are subject to one or more of the following forms of pre-employment safety screening such as Police Records Check, Inherent Position Requirements Employee Declaration, Working with Children Check, Disability Worker Exclusion Scheme Check, Reference Checks and AHPRA Registration Check. This role is only available to Australian Residents or to those who hold the right to work in Australia. Yooralla is an equal opportunity employer.

  • Information Technology and Services
  • Health, Wellness and Fitness

Job description

The Role

Reporting to the National Operations Manager, this people management role is responsible for ensuring the quality performance of a portfolio of OSHC services. You must be self-motivated, have the drive to succeed and understand the balance between accountability and responsibility. Your ‘can do’ attitude will contribute to your success and progress!

Key Responsibilities
  • Effective service management of OSHC and vacation care services in accordance with National Quality Framework and relevant regulations.
  • High quality program planning, execution and evaluation to achieve excellence in compliance and assessment standards.
  • Sound people management of stakeholders including school leaders, parents, regulatory authorities, educators and the management.
  • Provide support, training and supervision to educators to build high-performing and engaging teams.
  • Shift rostering and attendance management.

Essential Criteria
  • Relevant management experience preferably in Education & Care industry.
  • Demonstrated ability to build and maintain effective stakeholder relationships.
  • Demonstrated ability in program planning, implementation, evaluation and reporting.
  • Demonstrated effective problem solving, planning and organisation skills.
  • Understanding of NQF, MTOP frameworks and relevant regulations.
  • Proven track record with measurable outcomes.
  • Current Working with Children Check or willingness to obtain.
  • Current Driver's Licence and own transport.
  • Completed, working towards or willing to commence relevant qualifications (Diploma of Children's Services or Bachelor of Education).
The Benefit
  • Autonomous full-time position with travel involved.
  • Career progression and professional development.
  • Supportive management and effective mentoring to ensure your success.
  • Great culture, engaging team and positive work environment.
  • Business tools - laptop, tablet, phone, travel allowance.
The Team

The difference is Extend. There has never been a better time to join our dynamic and passionate team. We are seeking an individual who is looking for an exciting, challenging and rewarding career.

At Extend our focus is on quality - providing the opportunities kids should have through engaging and educational activities. If this resonates with you, then join the team with a difference!

How To Apply

This is a great career opportunity for a suitable candidate seeking a dynamic role with a national family owned and operated OSHC provider.

Please submit your Cover Letter addressing the essential criteria and Resume today. For more information contact our Head Office 1300 366 437.

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Lydia Yew on , quoting Ref No. 825971.
